intro: Astrantia major f. integra, commonly known as the European aster or common garden aster, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It features showy, flat-topped flower heads composed of numerous small, pink to purple florets. The plant has lance-shaped, dark green leaves with toothed margins that are arranged alternately along the stem. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in partial shade to full sun. The flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
